snippet: Though over one million people are thought to use marijuana to treat ailments, there are few studies on its effectiveness. A major reason: The federal government puts tight restrictions on research.
abstract: More than one million people are thought to use marijuana for treatment of ailments, but federal government continues to categorize it as Schedule 1 drug, making it difficult to obtain for medical research; Dr Sue Sisley’s case is an extreme example of obstacles and frustrations scientists face in trying to study medical uses of marijuana; Sisley says University of Arizona fired her because of her outspoken support for marijuana research.
lead_paragraph: Though over one million people are thought to use marijuana to treat ailments, there are few studies on its effectiveness. A major reason: The federal government puts tight restrictions on research.

headline.main: Medical Marijuana Research Hits Wall of U.S. Law
